channel.title: Client theme's
channel.description:
Well, I am not experienced with theme's at all, So i was wondering how i would change the theme of my client.
I went to explore how theme's worked and i found these imports.
[code] import javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel; [/code] [code] import theme.RedTheme; [/code]
And this little sucker right here.
[code] MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new RedTheme()); [/code]
I was wondering how i would set a different theme.
i have tried different theme import's but it always says that they are not declared...but the current theme is not declared ether so i am clueless.

so i am clueless.
[/quote]So is mscp ziplock… So is mscp…[/quote]

I guess so… I checked out java’s site and there doc’s and javabook’s, But still no luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Client theme's
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Well, I am not experienced with theme’s at all, So i was wondering how i would change the theme of my client.

I went to explore how theme’s worked and i found these imports.

import javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel;
import theme.RedTheme;

And this little sucker right here.

			MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new RedTheme());

I was wondering how i would set a different theme.

i have tried different theme import’s but it always says that they are not declared…but the current theme is not declared ether so i am clueless.

Read full topic
